member.name: F:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.CVAR_INDEX_ECOMMERCE_ITEM_PRICE
member.summary: Ecommerce item page view tracking stores item's metadata in these Custom Variables slots.

member.name: F:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.URL
member.summary: Piwik base URL, for example http://example.org/piwik/ Must be set before using the class by calling PiwikTracker.URL = 'http://yourwebsite.org/piwik/'

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Builds a PiwikTracker object, used to track visits, pages and Goal conversions for a specific website, by using the Piwik Tracking API.
If the tracker is used within a web page or web controller, the following information are pre-initialised : URL Referrer, current page URL, remote IP, Accept-Language HTTP header and User-Agent HTTP header.
member.param: "http://example.org/piwik/" or "http://piwik.example.org/". If set, will overwrite PiwikTracker.URL

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setPageCharset(System.String)
member.summary: By default, Piwik expects utf-8 encoded values, for example for the page URL parameter values, Page Title, etc. It is recommended to only send UTF-8 data to Piwik. If required though, you can also specify another charset using this function.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current URL being tracked

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setUrlReferrer(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the URL referrer used to track Referrers details for new visits.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setGenerationTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the time that generating the document on the server side took.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setCustomVariable(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Piwik.Tracker.CustomVar.Scopes)
member.summary: Sets Visit Custom Variable. See http://piwik.org/docs/custom-variables/
member.param: Custom variable scope. Possible values: visit, page, event

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getCustomVariable(System.Int32,Piwik.Tracker.CustomVar.Scopes)
member.summary:
Returns the currently assigned Custom Variable.
If scope is 'visit', it will attempt to read the value set in the first party cookie created by Piwik Tracker ($_COOKIE array).
member.param: Custom Variable integer index to fetch from cookie. Should be a value from 1 to 5
Custom variable scope. Possible values: visit, page, event

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setNewVisitorId
member.summary: Sets the current visitor ID to a random new one.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setIdSite(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the current site ID.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setBrowserLanguage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Browser language. Used to guess visitor countries when GeoIP is not enabled

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setUserAgent(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the user agent, used to detect OS and browser. If this function is not called, the User Agent will default to the current user agent if there is an active HttpContext

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setCountry(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the country of the visitor. If not used, Piwik will try to find the country using either the visitor's IP address or language.
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setRegion(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the region of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the region using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so).
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setCity(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the city of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the city using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so).
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setLatitude(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the latitude of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the visitor's latitude using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so).
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setLongitude(System.Single)
member.summary:
Sets the longitude of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the visitor's longitude using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so).
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.enableBulkTracking
member.summary: Enables the bulk request feature. When used, each tracking action is stored until the doBulkTrack method is called. This method will send all tracking data at once.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.enableCookies(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enable Cookie Creation - this will cause a first party VisitorId cookie to be set when the VisitorId is set or reset
member.param: (optional) Set first-party cookie domain. Accepted values: example.com, *.example.com (same as .example.com) or subdomain.example.com

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.domainFixup(System.String)
member.summary: Fix-up domain

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackPageView(System.String)
member.summary: Tracks a page view
member.param: Page title as it will appear in the Actions > Page titles report
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tracks an event
member.param: The Event's Action (Play, Pause, Duration, Add Playlist, Downloaded, Clicked...)
(optional) The Event's object Name (a particular Movie name, or Song name, or File name...)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackSiteSearch(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Tracks an internal Site Search query, and optionally tracks the Search Category, and Search results Count. These are used to populate reports in Actions > Site Search.
member.param: (optional) results displayed on the search result page. Used to track "zero result" keywords.
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackGoal(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Records a Goal conversion
member.param: Id Goal to record a conversion
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackAction(System.String,Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.ActionType)
member.summary: Tracks a download or outlink
member.param: URL of the download or outlink
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.addEcommerceItem(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Double,System.UInt64)
member.summary:
Adds an item in the Ecommerce order.
This should be called before doTrackEcommerceOrder(), or before doTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(). This function can be called for all individual products in the cart (or order). SKU parameter is mandatory. Other parameters are optional (set to false if value not known). Ecommerce items added via this function are automatically cleared when doTrackEcommerceOrder() or getUrlTrackEcommerceOrder() is called.
member.param: Array of product categories (up to 5 categories can be specified for a given product)
Individual product price (supports integer and decimal prices)
Product quantity. If not specified, will default to 1 in the Reports

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(System.Double)
member.summary:
Tracks a Cart Update (add item, remove item, update item).
On every Cart update, you must call addEcommerceItem() for each item (product) in the cart, including the items that haven't been updated since the last cart update. Items which were in the previous cart and are not sent in later Cart updates will be deleted from the cart (in the database).
member.param: Cart grandTotal (typically the sum of all items' prices)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doBulkTrack
member.summary:
Sends all stored tracking actions at once. Only has an effect if bulk tracking is enabled.
To enable bulk tracking, call enableBulkTracking().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.doTrackEcommerceOrder(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Tracks an Ecommerce order.
If the Ecommerce order contains items (products), you must call first the addEcommerceItem() for each item in the order. All revenues (grandTotal, subTotal, tax, shipping, discount) will be individually summed and reported in Piwik reports. Only the parameters $orderId and $grandTotal are required.
member.param: Unique Order ID. This will be used to count this order only once in the event the order page is reloaded several times. orderId must be unique for each transaction, even on different days, or the transaction will not be recorded by Piwik.
Grand Total revenue of the transaction (including tax, shipping, etc.)
Sub total amount, typically the sum of items prices for all items in this order (before Tax and Shipping costs are applied)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce Cart updates Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackEcommerceOrder(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce Orders Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackEcommerce(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce orders Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackPageView(System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a page view.
member.param: Page view name as it will appear in Piwik reports
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a custom event.
member.param: The Event's Action (Play, Pause, Duration, Add Playlist, Downloaded, Clicked...)
(optional) The Event's object Name (a particular Movie name, or Song name, or File name...)
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackSiteSearch(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Builds URL to track a site search.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackGoal(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a goal with idGoal and revenue.
member.param: Id Goal to record a conversion
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the goal conversion

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getUrlTrackAction(System.String,Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.ActionType)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a new action.
member.param: URL of the download or outlink
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track an action

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setForceVisitDateTime(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary:
Overrides server date and time for the tracking requests. By default Piwik will track requests for the "current datetime" but this function allows you to track visits in the past. All times are in UTC.
Allowed only for Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setIp(System.String)
member.summary:
Overrides IP address
Allowed only for Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setVisitorId(System.String)
member.summary:
Forces the requests to be recorded for the specified Visitor ID rather than using the heuristics based on IP and other attributes.
This is typically used with the Javascript getVisitorId() function.
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().
You may set the Visitor ID based on a user attribute, for example the user email: $v->setVisitorId( substr(md5( $userEmail ), 0, 16));
If not set, the visitor ID will be fetched from the 1st party cookie, or will be set to a random UUID.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getVisitorId
member.summary:
If the user initiating the request has the Piwik first party cookie, this function will try and return the ID parsed from this first party cookie.
If you call this function from a server, where the call is triggered by a cron or script not initiated by the actual visitor being tracked, then it will return the random Visitor ID that was assigned to this visit object.
This can be used if you wish to record more visits, actions or goals for this visitor ID later on.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.loadVisitorIdCookie
member.summary: Loads values from the VisitorId Cookie
member.returns: True if cookie exists and is valid, False otherwise

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.deleteCookies
member.summary: Deletes all first party cookies from the client

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getAttributionInfo
member.summary:
Returns the currently assigned Attribution Information stored in a first party cookie.
This function will only work if the user is initiating the current request, and his cookies can be read from an active HttpContext.
member.returns: Referrer information for Goal conversion attribution. Will return null if the cookie could not be found

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setLocalTime(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Sets local visitor time

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setResolution(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets user resolution width and height.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setBrowserHasCookies(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets if the browser supports cookies This is reported in "List of plugins" report in Piwik.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setDebugStringAppend(System.String)
member.summary: Will append a custom string at the end of the Tracking request.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setPlugins(Piwik.Tracker.BrowserPlugins)
member.summary: Sets visitor browser supported plugins

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.disableCookieSupport
member.summary: By default, PiwikTracker will read first party cookies from the request and write updated cookies in the response (using setrawcookie). This can be disabled by calling this function.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getRequestTimeout
member.summary: Returns the maximum number of seconds the tracker will spend waiting for a response from Piwik. Defaults to 600 seconds.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setRequestTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of seconds that the tracker will spend waiting for a response from Piwik.

member.name: F:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DEBUG_LAST_REQUESTED_URL
member.summary: Used in tests to output useful error messages.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getBaseUrl
member.summary: Returns the base URL for the piwik server.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.getCurrentUrl
member.summary: Returns the current full URL (scheme, host, path and query string.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setFirstPartyCookies
member.summary: Sets the first party cookies as would the piwik.js All cookies are supported: 'id' and 'ses' and 'ref' and 'cvar' cookies.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.setCookie(System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets a first party cookie to the client to improve dual JS-PHP tracking.
This replicates the piwik.js tracker algorithms for consistency and better accuracy.
